trans-unit.source: How Tos

How can we pass our custom array type through this function? Numpy allows a class to indicate that it would like to handle computations in a custom-defined way through the interfaces __array_ufunc__ and __array_function__. Let’s take one at a time, starting with _array_ufunc__. This method covers Universal functions (ufunc), a class of functions that includes, for example, numpy.multiply and numpy.sin.

How do we construct a 2D array from a list of equally-sized row vectors? In MATLAB this is quite easy: if x and y are two vectors of the same length you only need do m=[x;y]. In NumPy this works via the functions column_stack, dstack, hstack and vstack, depending on the dimension in which the stacking is to be done. For example:

How do we know when consensus has been achieved? In principle, this is rather difficult, since consensus is defined by the absence of vetos, which requires us to somehow prove a negative. In practice, we use a combination of our best judgement (e.g., a simple and uncontroversial bug fix posted on GitHub and reviewed by a core developer is probably fine) and best efforts (e.g., all substantive API changes must be posted to the mailing list in order to give the broader community a chance to catch any problems and suggest improvements; we assume that anyone who cares enough about NumPy to invoke their veto right should be on the mailing list). If no-one bothers to comment on the mailing list after a few days, then it’s probably fine. And worst case, if a change is more controversial than expected, or a crucial critique is delayed because someone was on vacation, then it’s no big deal: we apologize for misjudging the situation, back up, and sort things out.

trans-unit.source: How to use an array iterator on a C-level is explained more fully in later sections. Typically, you do not need to concern yourself with the internal structure of the iterator object, and merely interact with it through the use of the macros PyArray_ITER_NEXT (it), PyArray_ITER_GOTO (it, dest), or PyArray_ITER_GOTO1D (it, index). All of these macros require the argument it to be a PyArrayIterObject *.

Todas estas macros requieren el argumento de que sea un PyArrayIterObject * .

Loading the absolute path name requires a little finesse for cross-platform work since the extension of shared libraries varies. There is a ctypes.util.find_library utility available that can simplify the process of finding the library to load but it is not foolproof. Complicating matters, different platforms have different default extensions used by shared libraries (e.g. .dll – Windows, .so – Linux, .dylib – Mac OS X). If <filename.pyf> is specified as stdout then signatures are send to standard output instead of a file.

If <fortran files> contains a signature file, then a source for an extension module is constructed, all Fortran and C sources are compiled, and finally all object and library files are linked to the extension module <modulename>.so which is saved into the current directory.
If <fortran files> does not contain a signature file, then an extension module is constructed by scanning all Fortran source codes for routine signatures.

trans-unit.target: Si A.ndim > d , las reps se promueven a A .ndim con 1 pre-pendientes. Por lo tanto, para una A de forma (2, 3, 4, 5), las reps de (2, 2) se tratan como (1, 1, 2, 2).

trans-unit.source: If A.ndim < d, A is promoted to be d-dimensional by prepending new axes. So a shape (3,) array is promoted to (1, 3) for 2-D replication, or shape (1, 1, 3) for 3-D replication. If this is not the desired behavior, promote A to d-dimensions manually before calling this function.
trans-unit.target: Si A.ndim < d , A se promueve a d-dimensional anteponiendo nuevos ejes. Entonces, una matriz de forma (3,) se promueve a (1, 3) para la replicación 2-D, o forma (1, 1, 3) para la replicación 3-D. Si este no es el comportamiento deseado, promueva las dimensiones A a d manualmente antes de llamar a esta función.

trans-unit.source: If True, use a digit-generation strategy which gives the shortest representation which uniquely identifies the floating-point number from other values of the same type, by judicious rounding. If precision was omitted, print all necessary digits, otherwise digit generation is cut off after precision digits and the remaining value is rounded. If False, digits are generated as if printing an infinite-precision value and stopping after precision digits, rounding the remaining value.
trans-unit.target: Si es True , utilice una estrategia de generación de dígitos que proporcione la representación más corta que identifique de forma única el número de punto flotante de otros valores del mismo tipo, mediante un redondeo juicioso. Si se omitió la precision , imprima todos los dígitos necesarios; de lo contrario, la generación de dígitos se corta después de precision dígitos de precisión y el valor restante se redondea. Si es False , los dígitos se generan como si se imprimiera un valor de precisión infinita y se detuvieran después de precision dígitos de precisión , redondeando el valor restante.

trans-unit.source: If True, use a digit-generation strategy which gives the shortest representation which uniquely identifies the floating-point number from other values of the same type, by judicious rounding. If precision was omitted, print out all necessary digits, otherwise digit generation is cut off after precision digits and the remaining value is rounded. If False, digits are generated as if printing an infinite-precision value and stopping after precision digits, rounding the remaining value.
trans-unit.target: Si es True , utilice una estrategia de generación de dígitos que proporcione la representación más corta que identifique de forma única el número de punto flotante de otros valores del mismo tipo, mediante un redondeo juicioso. Si se omitió la precision , imprima todos los dígitos necesarios; de lo contrario, la generación de dígitos se corta después de precision dígitos de precisión y el valor restante se redondea. Si es False , los dígitos se generan como si se imprimiera un valor de precisión infinita y se detuvieran después de precision dígitos de precisión , redondeando el valor restante.

trans-unit.source: If a.fill_value == b.fill_value, return the fill value, otherwise return None.

trans-unit.source: If a.ndim > 2, then the dimensions specified by axis1 and axis2 are removed, and a new axis inserted at the end corresponding to the diagonal.
trans-unit.target: Si a.ndim > 2 , se eliminan las dimensiones especificadas por axis1 y axis2 , y se inserta un nuevo eje en el extremo correspondiente a la diagonal.

trans-unit.target: Si a.ndim es 0, dado que la profundidad de la lista anidada es 0, no será una lista en absoluto, sino un simple escalar de Python.

trans-unit.source: If a and b are nonscalar, their last dimensions must match.
trans-unit.target: Si a y b son escalar, sus últimas dimensiones deben coincidir.

trans-unit.target: Si a y cada matriz de opciones no son todas asignables a la misma forma.

trans-unit.source: If a does not own its own data or references or views to it exist, and the data memory must be changed. PyPy only: will always raise if the data memory must be changed, since there is no reliable way to determine if references or views to it exist.
trans-unit.target: Si a no posee sus propios datos o referencias o vistas, existen, y la memoria de datos debe cambiarse. Solo PyPy: siempre se generará si se debe cambiar la memoria de datos, ya que no hay una forma confiable de determinar si existen referencias o vistas a ella.

trans-unit.source: If a has more than two dimensions, then broadcasting rules apply, as explained in Linear algebra on several matrices at once. This means that SVD is working in “stacked” mode: it iterates over all indices of the first a.ndim - 2 dimensions and for each combination SVD is applied to the last two indices. The matrix a can be reconstructed from the decomposition with either (u * s[..., None, :]) @ vh or u @ (s[..., None] * vh). (The @ operator can be replaced by the function np.matmul for python versions below 3.5.)
trans-unit.target: Si a tiene más de dos dimensiones, entonces se aplican las reglas de transmisión, como se explica en Álgebra lineal en varias matrices a la vez . Esto significa que SVD está trabajando en modo "apilado": itera sobre todos los índices de la primera a.ndim - 2 dimensiones y para cada combinación SVD se aplica a los dos últimos índices. La matriz a se puede reconstruir a partir de la descomposición con (u * s[..., None, :]) @ vh o u @ (s[..., None] * vh) . (El operador @ puede ser reemplazado por la función np.matmul para versiones de Python por debajo de 3.5).

trans-unit.source: If a has more than two dimensions, then the axes specified by axis1 and axis2 are used to determine the 2-D sub-arrays whose traces are returned. The shape of the resulting array is the same as that of a with axis1 and axis2 removed.
trans-unit.target: Si a tiene más de dos dimensiones, los ejes especificados por axis1 y axis2 se utilizan para determinar las submatrices 2-D cuyas trazas se devuelven. La forma de la matriz resultante es la misma que la de a con axis1 y axis2 eliminados.

trans-unit.source: If a is 1-D, the function ufunc.accumulate(a) is the same as ufunc.reduceat(a, indices)[::2] where indices is range(len(array) - 1) with a zero placed in every other element: indices = zeros(2 * len(a) - 1), indices[1::2] = range(1, len(a)).
trans-unit.target: Si a es 1-D, la función ufunc.accumulate(a) es la misma que ufunc.reduceat(a, indices)[::2] donde los indices son range(len(array) - 1) con un cero colocado en cada otro elemento: indices = zeros(2 * len(a) - 1) , indices[1::2] = range(1, len(a)) .

trans-unit.source: If a is 2-D, returns the diagonal of a with the given offset, i.e., the collection of elements of the form a[i, i+offset]. If a has more than two dimensions, then the axes specified by axis1 and axis2 are used to determine the 2-D sub-array whose diagonal is returned. The shape of the resulting array can be determined by removing axis1 and axis2 and appending an index to the right equal to the size of the resulting diagonals.
trans-unit.target: Si a es 2-D, devuelve la diagonal de a con el desplazamiento dado, es decir, la colección de elementos de la forma a[i, i+offset] . Si a tiene más de dos dimensiones, entonces los ejes especificados por axis1 y axis2 se utilizan para determinar la submatriz 2-D cuya diagonal se devuelve. La forma de la matriz resultante se puede determinar quitando axis1 y axis2 y agregando un índice a la derecha igual al tamaño de las diagonales resultantes.

trans-unit.source: If a is 2-D, the sum along its diagonal with the given offset is returned, i.e., the sum of elements a[i,i+offset] for all i.
trans-unit.target: Si a es 2-D, se devuelve la suma a lo largo de su diagonal con el desplazamiento dado, es decir, la suma de los elementos a[i,i+offset] para todo i.

trans-unit.source: If a is 2-D, the sum along the diagonal is returned. If a has larger dimensions, then an array of sums along diagonals is returned.
trans-unit.target: Si a es 2-D, se devuelve la suma a lo largo de la diagonal. Si a tiene dimensiones más grandes, se devuelve una matriz de sumas a lo largo de las diagonales.

trans-unit.source: If a is 2-D, then a 1-D array containing the diagonal and of the same type as a is returned unless a is a matrix, in which case a 1-D array rather than a (2-D) matrix is returned in order to maintain backward compatibility.
trans-unit.target: Si a es una matriz de 1-D que contiene la diagonal y 2-D, a continuación, del mismo tipo como a se devuelve a menos que a es una matrix , en cuyo caso una matriz de 1-D en lugar de un (2-D) matrix se devuelve para mantener la compatibilidad con versiones anteriores.

trans-unit.source: If a is a matrix object (as opposed to an ndarray), then so are all the return values.
trans-unit.target: Si a es un objeto de matrix (a diferencia de un ndarray ), entonces también lo son todos los valores de retorno.

trans-unit.source: If a is a reference to b, then (a is b) == True. Therefore, a and b are different names for the same Python object.
If a is a subclass of MaskedArray, its class is conserved. No copy is performed if the input is already an ndarray.
If a is a subclass of MaskedArray, its class is conserved. No copy is performed if the input is already an ndarray.
trans-unit.target: Si a es una subclase de MaskedArray , su clase se conserva. No se realiza ninguna copia si la entrada ya es un ndarray .

trans-unit.source: If a is an N-D array and b is a 1-D array, it is a sum product over the last axis of a and b.
trans-unit.target: Si a es una matriz ND y b es una matriz de 1-D, que es un producto suma sobre el último eje de a y b .

trans-unit.source: If a is an N-D array and b is an M-D array (where M>=2), it is a sum product over the last axis of a and the second-to-last axis of b:
trans-unit.target: Si a es una matriz ND y b es una matriz MD (donde M>=2 ), que es un producto suma sobre el último eje de a y la segunda a última eje de b :

trans-unit.source: If a is complex the complex conjugate is taken before calculation of the dot product.
trans-unit.target: Si a es complejo, el conjugado complejo se toma antes del cálculo del producto escalar.

trans-unit.source: If a is not a MaskedArray, a itself is returned. If a is a MaskedArray and fill_value is None, fill_value is set to a.fill_value.
trans-unit.target: Si a no es un MaskedArray , a sí es devuelto. Si a es un MaskedArray y fill_value es None, fill_value se establece en a.fill_value .

trans-unit.source: If a is not square or inversion fails.
trans-unit.target: Si a no es cuadrado o falla la inversión.

trans-unit.source: If a is real, the type of a is used for the output. If a has complex elements, the returned type is float.
trans-unit.target: Si a es real, se usa el tipo de a para la salida. Si a tiene elementos complejos, el tipo devuelto es flotador.

trans-unit.source: If a is singular or not ‘square’ (in the above sense).
trans-unit.target: Si a es singular o no 'cuadrado' (en el sentido anterior).

trans-unit.source: If align=False, this method produces a “packed” memory layout in which each field starts at the byte the previous field ended, and any padding bytes are removed.

If align=True is set, numpy will pad the structure in the same way many C compilers would pad a C-struct. Aligned structures can give a performance improvement in some cases, at the cost of increased datatype size. Padding bytes are inserted between fields such that each field’s byte offset will be a multiple of that field’s alignment, which is usually equal to the field’s size in bytes for simple datatypes, see PyArray_Descr.alignment. The structure will also have trailing padding added so that its itemsize is a multiple of the largest field’s alignment.

If align=True, this methods produces an “aligned” memory layout in which each field’s offset is a multiple of its alignment, and the total itemsize is a multiple of the largest alignment, by adding padding bytes as needed.
If arr doesn’t have a shape attribute (i.e. not an ndarray)

trans-unit.source: If axis is 0, only rows are masked.
trans-unit.target: Si el axis es 0, solo se enmascaran las filas.

trans-unit.source: If axis is 1 or -1, only columns are masked.
trans-unit.target: Si el axis es 1 o -1, solo se enmascaran las columnas.

trans-unit.target: Si el axis es Ninguno, las filas y columnas están enmascaradas.

trans-unit.source: If axis is None, the result is a scalar. Otherwise, if axis is given and the array is at least 2-D, the result is a masked array with dimension one smaller than the array on which mini is called.

If axis is an integer, it specifies the axis of x along which to compute the vector norms. If axis is a 2-tuple, it specifies the axes that hold 2-D matrices, and the matrix norms of these matrices are computed. If axis is None then either a vector norm (when x is 1-D) or a matrix norm (when x is 2-D) is returned.
trans-unit.target: Si el axis es un número entero, especifica el eje de x a lo largo del cual calcular las normas vectoriales. Si axis es una tupla bidimensional, especifica los ejes que contienen matrices bidimensionales y se calculan las normas matriciales de estas matrices. Si el axis es Ninguno, se devuelve una norma vectorial (cuando x es 1-D) o una norma matricial (cuando x es 2-D).

trans-unit.source: If axis is an integer, it specifies the axis of x along which to compute the vector norms. If axis is a 2-tuple, it specifies the axes that hold 2-D matrices, and the matrix norms of these matrices are computed. If axis is None then either a vector norm (when x is 1-D) or a matrix norm (when x is 2-D) is returned. The default is None.
If axis is given, the number of varargs must equal the number of axes. Default: 1.

If b = a[:100] is used instead, a is referenced by b and will persist in memory even if del a is executed.
If b is a matrix, then all array results are returned as matrices.
trans-unit.target: Si b es una matriz, todos los resultados de la matriz se devuelven como matrices.

trans-unit.source: If bins is a string from the list below, histogram_bin_edges will use the method chosen to calculate the optimal bin width and consequently the number of bins (see Notes for more detail on the estimators) from the data that falls within the requested range. While the bin width will be optimal for the actual data in the range, the number of bins will be computed to fill the entire range, including the empty portions. For visualisation, using the ‘auto’ option is suggested. Weighted data is not supported for automated bin size selection.
trans-unit.target: Si bins es una cadena de la lista siguiente, histogram_bin_edges utilizará el método elegido para calcular el ancho óptimo del bin y, en consecuencia, el número de bins (consulte Notes para obtener más detalles sobre los estimadores) a partir de los datos que se encuentran dentro del rango solicitado. Si bien el ancho del contenedor será óptimo para los datos reales en el rango, el número de contenedores se calculará para llenar todo el rango, incluidas las porciones vacías. Para la visualización, se sugiere usar la opción 'auto'. Los datos ponderados no son compatibles con la selección automática del tamaño del contenedor.

trans-unit.source: If bins is a string, it defines the method used to calculate the optimal bin width, as defined by histogram_bin_edges.
trans-unit.target: Si bins es una cadena, define el método utilizado para calcular el ancho óptimo de bin, según lo definido por histogram_bin_edges .

trans-unit.source: If bins is an int, it defines the number of equal-width bins in the given range (10, by default). If bins is a sequence, it defines a monotonically increasing array of bin edges, including the rightmost edge, allowing for non-uniform bin widths.
trans-unit.target: Si bins es un int, define el número de bins de igual ancho en el rango dado (10, por defecto). Si bins es una secuencia, define una matriz de bordes de bin que aumenta monótonamente, incluido el borde más a la derecha, lo que permite anchos de bin no uniformes.

trans-unit.source: If bins is an int, it defines the number of equal-width bins in the given range (10, by default). If bins is a sequence, it defines the bin edges, including the rightmost edge, allowing for non-uniform bin widths.
trans-unit.target: Si bins es un int, define el número de bins de igual ancho en el rango dado (10, por defecto). Si los bins son una secuencia, define los bordes del contenedor, incluido el borde más a la derecha, lo que permite anchos de contenedor no uniformes.

trans-unit.source: If bins is not monotonic.
trans-unit.target: Si bins no es monótono.

trans-unit.source: If buffer is None, then only shape, dtype, and order are used.
trans-unit.target: Si el buffer es Ninguno, solo se utilizan la shape , el dtype y el order .

If buffer is an object exposing the buffer interface, then all keywords are interpreted.

trans-unit.source: If buffersize is zero, a default buffer size is used, otherwise it specifies how big of a buffer to use. Buffers which are powers of 2 such as 4096 or 8192 are recommended.
trans-unit.target: Si el buffersize es cero, se usa un tamaño de búfer predeterminado; de lo contrario, especifica qué tamaño de búfer se debe usar. Se recomiendan búferes con potencias de 2, como 4096 u 8192.

trans-unit.source: If c has fewer than 3 dimensions, ones are implicitly appended to its shape to make it 3-D. The shape of the result will be c.shape[3:] + x.shape.
trans-unit.target: Si c tiene menos de 3 dimensiones, se añaden unos implícitamente a su forma para convertirla en 3-D. La forma del resultado será c.shape [3:] + x.shape.

trans-unit.source: If c has fewer than three dimensions, ones are implicitly appended to its shape to make it 3-D. The shape of the result will be c.shape[3:] + x.shape + y.shape + z.shape.

trans-unit.source: If c has fewer than two dimensions, ones are implicitly appended to its shape to make it 2-D. The shape of the result will be c.shape[2:] + x.shape + y.shape.
trans-unit.target: Si c tiene menos de dos dimensiones, se añaden unas implícitamente a su forma para convertirla en 2-D. La forma del resultado será c.shape [2:] + x.shape + y.shape.

trans-unit.source: If c is a 1-D array a one is implicitly appended to its shape to make it 2-D. The shape of the result will be c.shape[2:] + x.shape.
trans-unit.target: Si c es una matriz 1-D, se agrega uno implícitamente a su forma para convertirla en 2-D. La forma del resultado será c.shape [2:] + x.shape.

trans-unit.source: If c is a 1-D array of coefficients of length n + 1 and V is the array V = hermevander(x, n), then np.dot(V, c) and hermeval(x, c) are the same up to roundoff. This equivalence is useful both for least squares fitting and for the evaluation of a large number of HermiteE series of the same degree and sample points.
trans-unit.target: Si c es una matriz 1-D de coeficientes de longitud n + 1 y V es la matriz V = hermevander(x, n) , entonces np.dot(V, c) y hermeval(x, c) son iguales hasta redondear. Esta equivalencia es útil tanto para el ajuste por mínimos cuadrados como para la evaluación de un gran número de series HermiteE del mismo grado y puntos muestrales.

trans-unit.source: If c is a 1-D array of coefficients of length n + 1 and V is the array V = hermvander(x, n), then np.dot(V, c) and hermval(x, c) are the same up to roundoff. This equivalence is useful both for least squares fitting and for the evaluation of a large number of Hermite series of the same degree and sample points.
trans-unit.target: Si c es una matriz 1-D de coeficientes de longitud n + 1 y V es la matriz V = hermvander(x, n) , entonces np.dot(V, c) y hermval(x, c) son iguales hasta redondear. Esta equivalencia es útil tanto para el ajuste por mínimos cuadrados como para la evaluación de un gran número de series de Hermite del mismo grado y puntos muestrales.

This equivalence is useful both for least squares fitting and for the evaluation of a large number of Laguerre series of the same degree and sample points.

trans-unit.source: If c is a 1-D array of coefficients of length n + 1 and V is the array V = legvander(x, n), then np.dot(V, c) and legval(x, c) are the same up to roundoff. This equivalence is useful both for least squares fitting and for the evaluation of a large number of Legendre series of the same degree and sample points.

This equivalence is useful both for least squares fitting and for the evaluation of a large number of Chebyshev series of the same degree and sample points.

If n is even, A[-1] contains the term representing both positive and negative Nyquist frequency (+fs/2 and -fs/2), and must also be purely real. If n is odd, there is no term at fs/2; A[-1] contains the largest positive frequency (fs/2*(n-1)/n), and is complex in the general case.
trans-unit.target: Si n es par, A[-1] contiene el término que representa la frecuencia de Nyquist tanto positiva como negativa (+ fs / 2 y -fs / 2), y también debe ser puramente real. If obj.flags has NPY_ARRAY_WRITEBACKIFCOPY or (deprecated) NPY_ARRAY_UPDATEIFCOPY, this function clears the flags, DECREF s obj->base and makes it writeable, and sets obj->base to NULL. In contrast to PyArray_DiscardWritebackIfCopy it makes no attempt to copy the data from obj->base This undoes PyArray_SetWritebackIfCopyBase. Usually this is called after an error when you are finished with obj, just before Py_DECREF(obj). It may be called multiple times, or with NULL input.
trans-unit.target: Si obj.flags tiene NPY_ARRAY_WRITEBACKIFCOPY o (en desuso) NPY_ARRAY_UPDATEIFCOPY , esta función borra las banderas, DECREF s obj->base y lo hace escribible, y establece obj->base en NULL. A diferencia de PyArray_DiscardWritebackIfCopy , no intenta copiar los datos de obj->base . Esto deshace PyArray_SetWritebackIfCopyBase . Por lo general, esto se llama después de un error cuando termina con obj , justo antes de Py_DECREF(obj) . Se puede llamar varias veces o con una entrada NULL .

trans-unit.source: If obj.flags has NPY_ARRAY_WRITEBACKIFCOPY or (deprecated) NPY_ARRAY_UPDATEIFCOPY, this function clears the flags, DECREF s obj->base and makes it writeable, and sets obj->base to NULL. It then copies obj->data to obj->base->data, and returns the error state of the copy operation. This is the opposite of PyArray_SetWritebackIfCopyBase. Usually this is called once you are finished with obj, just before Py_DECREF(obj). It may be called multiple times, or with NULL input. See also PyArray_DiscardWritebackIfCopy.
trans-unit.target: Si obj.flags tiene NPY_ARRAY_WRITEBACKIFCOPY o (en desuso) NPY_ARRAY_UPDATEIFCOPY , esta función borra las banderas, DECREF s obj->base y lo hace escribible, y establece obj->base en NULL. Luego copia obj->data a obj->base->data y devuelve el estado de error de la operación de copia. Esto es lo opuesto a PyArray_SetWritebackIfCopyBase . Por lo general, esto se llama una vez que haya terminado con obj , justo antes de Py_DECREF(obj) . Se puede llamar varias veces o con una entrada NULL . Consulte también PyArray_DiscardWritebackIfCopy .

trans-unit.source: If r is a 1-D array, then p(x) will have the same shape as x. If r is multidimensional, then the shape of the result depends on the value of tensor. If tensor is ``True` the shape will be r.shape[1:] + x.shape; that is, each polynomial is evaluated at every value of x. If tensor is False, the shape will be r.shape[1:]; that is, each polynomial is evaluated only for the corresponding broadcast value of x. Note that scalars have shape (,).
trans-unit.target: Si r es una matriz 1-D, entonces p(x) tendrá la misma forma que x . Si r es multidimensional, entonces la forma del resultado depende del valor del tensor . Si el tensor es False , la forma será r.shape [1:]; es decir, cada polinomio se evalúa solo para el valor de difusión correspondiente de x . Tenga en cuenta que los escalares tienen forma (,).

trans-unit.source: If x is a poly1d instance, the result is the composition of the two polynomials, i.e., x is “substituted” in p and the simplified result is returned. In addition, the type of x - array_like or poly1d - governs the type of the output: x array_like => values array_like, x a poly1d object => values is also.
trans-unit.target: Si x es una instancia poly1d, el resultado es la composición de los dos polinomios, es decir, x se "sustituye" en p y se devuelve el resultado simplificado. Además, el tipo de x - array_like o poly1d - gobierna el tipo de salida: x array_like => values array_like, x un objeto poly1d => values también lo es.

trans-unit.source: If x is a sequence, then p(x) is returned for each element of x. If x is another polynomial then the composite polynomial p(x(t)) is returned.
trans-unit.target: Si x es una secuencia, se devuelve p(x) para cada elemento de x . Si x es otro polinomio, se devuelve el polinomio compuesto p(x(t)) .

trans-unit.source: If x is a subtype of ndarray the return value will be of the same type.
trans-unit.target: Si x es un subtipo de ndarray , el valor devuelto será del mismo tipo.

trans-unit.source: If x is an integer, randomly permute np.arange(x). If x is an array, make a copy and shuffle the elements randomly.
trans-unit.target: Si x es un número entero, permuta aleatoriamente np.arange(x) . Si x es una matriz, haga una copia y mezcle los elementos al azar.

trans-unit.source: If x is inexact, NaN is replaced by zero or by the user defined value in nan keyword, infinity is replaced by the largest finite floating point values representable by x.dtype or by the user defined value in posinf keyword and -infinity is replaced by the most negative finite floating point values representable by x.dtype or by the user defined value in neginf keyword.
trans-unit.target: Si x es inexacta, NaN se sustituye por cero o por el valor definido por el usuario en nan palabra clave, el infinito se sustituye por el más grande finita valores de coma flotante representables por x.dtype o por el valor definido por el usuario en posinf palabra clave y se sustituye por -infinity los valores de coma flotante finitos más negativos representables por x.dtype o por el valor definido por el usuario en la palabra clave neginf .

trans-unit.source: If x is not inexact, then no replacements are made.
trans-unit.target: Si x no es inexacto, entonces no se realizan reemplazos.

trans-unit.source: If x is of a signed integer type, then the output type is the default platform integer:
trans-unit.target: Si x es de un tipo de entero con signo, entonces el tipo de salida es el entero de plataforma predeterminado:

trans-unit.source: If xp and fp have different length If xp or fp are not 1-D sequences If period == 0
trans-unit.target: Si xp y fp tienen una longitud diferente Si xp o fp no son secuencias 1-D Si period == 0

trans-unit.source: If arr is an array, returns its data type descriptor, but if arr is an array scalar (has 0 dimensions), it finds the data type of smallest size to which the value may be converted without overflow or truncation to an integer.
trans-unit.target: Si arr es una matriz, devuelve su descriptor de tipo de datos, pero si arr es un escalar de matriz (tiene 0 dimensiones), busca el tipo de datos de menor tamaño al que se puede convertir el valor sin desbordamiento o truncamiento a un número entero.

trans-unit.source: If axis is None (the default), the array is treated as a 1-D array and the operation is performed over the entire array. This behavior is also the default if self is a 0-dimensional array or array scalar. (An array scalar is an instance of the types/classes float32, float64, etc., whereas a 0-dimensional array is an ndarray instance containing precisely one array scalar.)
trans-unit.target: Si el eje es Ninguno (el valor predeterminado), la matriz se trata como una matriz 1-D y la operación se realiza en toda la matriz. Este comportamiento también es el predeterminado si self es una matriz de dimensión 0 o una matriz escalar. (Un arreglo escalar es una instancia de los tipos / clases float32, float64, etc., mientras que un arreglo de dimensión 0 es una instancia ndarray que contiene precisamente un arreglo escalar).

trans-unit.source: If axis is an integer, then the operation is done over the given axis (for each 1-D subarray that can be created along the given axis).
trans-unit.target: Si el eje es un número entero, entonces la operación se realiza sobre el eje dado (para cada subarreglo 1-D que se puede crear a lo largo del eje dado).

trans-unit.source: If data is NULL, then new unitinialized memory will be allocated and flags can be non-zero to indicate a Fortran-style contiguous array. Use PyArray_FILLWBYTE to initialize the memory.
trans-unit.target: Si los datos son NULL , entonces se asignará una nueva memoria unitaria inicializada y los indicadores pueden ser distintos de cero para indicar una matriz contigua al estilo Fortran. Utilice PyArray_FILLWBYTE para inicializar la memoria.

trans-unit.source: If data is not NULL, then it is assumed to point to the memory to be used for the array and the flags argument is used as the new flags for the array (except the state of NPY_ARRAY_OWNDATA, NPY_ARRAY_WRITEBACKIFCOPY and NPY_ARRAY_UPDATEIFCOPY flags of the new array will be reset).

If data is not NULL, then it is assumed to point to the memory to be used for the array and the flags argument is used as the new flags for the array (except the state of NPY_OWNDATA, NPY_ARRAY_WRITEBACKIFCOPY and NPY_ARRAY_UPDATEIFCOPY flags of the new array will be reset).
trans-unit.target: Si los datos no son NULL , se supone que apuntan a la memoria que se utilizará para la matriz y el argumento de banderas se usa como las nuevas banderas para la matriz (excepto el estado de NPY_OWNDATA , NPY_ARRAY_WRITEBACKIFCOPY y NPY_ARRAY_UPDATEIFCOPY de la nueva matriz ser reiniciado).

trans-unit.source: If descr is NULL, the data type of prototype is used.
trans-unit.target: Si descr es NULL, se utiliza el tipo de datos del prototipo .

trans-unit.source: If dtype is NULL, then the returned array will have the same data type as self. The new data-type must be consistent with the size of self. Either the itemsizes must be identical, or self must be single-segment and the total number of bytes must be the same. In the latter case the dimensions of the returned array will be altered in the last (or first for Fortran-style contiguous arrays) dimension. The data area of the returned array and self is exactly the same.
trans-unit.target: Si dtype es NULL , la matriz devuelta tendrá el mismo tipo de datos que self . El nuevo tipo de datos debe ser coherente con el tamaño de uno mismo . Los tamaños de los elementos deben ser idénticos o el self debe ser de un solo segmento y el número total de bytes debe ser el mismo. En el último caso, las dimensiones de la matriz devuelta se modificarán en la última dimensión (o la primera para las matrices contiguas estilo Fortran). El área de datos de la matriz devuelta y self es exactamente la misma.

trans-unit.source: If op is already an array, but does not satisfy the requirements, then a copy is made (which will satisfy the requirements). If this flag is present and a copy (of an object that is already an array) must be made, then the corresponding NPY_ARRAY_WRITEBACKIFCOPY flag is set in the returned copy and op is made to be read-only. You must be sure to call PyArray_ResolveWritebackIfCopy to copy the contents back into op and the op array will be made writeable again. If op is not writeable to begin with, or if it is not already an array, then an error is raised.
trans-unit.target: Si op ya es una matriz, pero no satisface los requisitos, se realiza una copia (que cumplirá los requisitos). Si esta bandera está presente y se debe hacer una copia (de un objeto que ya es una matriz), entonces la bandera NPY_ARRAY_WRITEBACKIFCOPY correspondiente se establece en la copia devuelta y op se hace para ser de solo lectura. Debe asegurarse de llamar a PyArray_ResolveWritebackIfCopy para copiar el contenido de nuevo en op y la matriz op se volverá a escribir. Si op no se puede escribir para empezar, o si aún no es una matriz, se genera un error.

trans-unit.source: If permute is NULL, the shape of the result is
trans-unit.target: Si permute es NULL , la forma del resultado es

trans-unit.source: If subok is 1, the newly created array will use the sub-type of prototype to create the new array, otherwise it will create a base-class array.
trans-unit.target: Si subok es 1, la matriz recién creada usará el subtipo de prototipo para crear la nueva matriz; de lo contrario, creará una matriz de clase base.

trans-unit.source: If subtype is of an array subclass instead of the base &PyArray_Type, then obj is the object to pass to the __array_finalize__ method of the subclass.
trans-unit.target: Si el subtipo es de una subclase de matriz en lugar de la base &PyArray_Type , entonces obj es el objeto para pasar al método __array_finalize__ de la subclase.

trans-unit.source: If subtype is of an array subclass instead of the base &PyArray_Type, then obj is the object to pass to the __array_finalize__ method of the subclass.
If A = qr such that q is orthonormal (which is always possible via Gram-Schmidt), then x = inv(r) * (q.T) * b. (In numpy practice, however, we simply use lstsq.)
trans-unit.target: Si A = qr tal que q es ortonormal (lo cual siempre es posible a través de Gram-Schmidt), entonces x = inv(r) * (q.T) * b . (En la práctica, sin embargo, simplemente usamos lstsq .)

trans-unit.source: If False, a view into the original arrays are returned in order to conserve memory. Default is True. Please note that sparse=False, copy=False will likely return non-contiguous arrays. Furthermore, more than one element of a broadcast array may refer to a single memory location. If you need to write to the arrays, make copies first.
trans-unit.target: Si es False, se devuelve una vista de las matrices originales para conservar memoria. El valor predeterminado es verdadero. Tenga en cuenta que sparse=False, copy=False probablemente devolverá matrices no contiguas. Además, más de un elemento de una matriz de difusión puede referirse a una única ubicación de memoria. Si necesita escribir en las matrices, primero haga copias.

trans-unit.source: If False, reference count will not be checked. Default is True.
trans-unit.target: Si es falso,no se comprobará el recuento de referencia.Por defecto es Verdadero.

trans-unit.source: If False, the default, returns the number of samples in each bin. If True, returns the probability density function at the bin, bin_count / sample_count / bin_area.
trans-unit.target: Si es False, el valor predeterminado devuelve el número de muestras en cada contenedor. Si es True, devuelve la función de densidad de probabilidad en el contenedor, bin_count / sample_count / bin_area .

trans-unit.source: If False, the default, returns the number of samples in each bin. If True, returns the probability density function at the bin, bin_count / sample_count / bin_volume.
trans-unit.target: Si es False, el valor predeterminado devuelve el número de muestras en cada contenedor. Si es True, devuelve la función de densidad de probabilidad en el contenedor, bin_count / sample_count / bin_volume .

trans-unit.source: If GitHub indicates that the branch of your Pull Request can no longer be merged automatically, you have to incorporate changes that have been made since you started into your branch. Our recommended way to do this is to rebase on master.
If K = min(M, N), then
trans-unit.target: Si K=min(M,N),entonces

trans-unit.source: If None, the index is into the flattened array, otherwise along the specified axis
trans-unit.target: Si no hay ninguno,el índice está en la matriz aplanada,de lo contrario a lo largo del eje especificado

trans-unit.source: If None, then the path is assumed to be the local path plus the subpackage_name. If a setup.py file is not found in the subpackage_path, then a default configuration is used.
trans-unit.target: Si no hay ninguno,entonces se asume que la ruta es la ruta local más el nombre del subpaquete.Si no se encuentra un archivo setup.py en la ruta_de_subpaquete,entonces se utiliza una configuración por defecto.

trans-unit.source: If None, use a MaskType instance. Otherwise, use a new datatype with the same fields as dtype, converted to boolean types.
If None, use a MaskType instance. Otherwise, use a new datatype with the same fields as dtype, converted to boolean types.
trans-unit.target: Si es None, use una instancia de MaskType. De lo contrario, use un nuevo tipo de datos con los mismos campos que dtype , convertido a tipos booleanos.

trans-unit.source: If Python None object is used as a required argument, the argument is treated as optional. That is, in the case of array argument, the memory is allocated. And if <init_expr> is given, the corresponding initialization is carried out.
If SVD computation does not converge.
trans-unit.target: Si el cálculo del SVD no converge.

trans-unit.source: If True (default) make a copy of a in the result. If False modify a in place and return a view.
trans-unit.target: Si es Verdadero (predeterminado), haga una copia de a en el resultado. Si es False, modifique a en el lugar y devuelva una vista.

trans-unit.source: If True (default), u and vh have the shapes (..., M, M) and (..., N, N), respectively. Otherwise, the shapes are (..., M, K) and (..., K, N), respectively, where K = min(M, N).
trans-unit.target: Si es True (predeterminado), u y vh tienen las formas (..., M, M) y (..., N, N) , respectivamente. De lo contrario, las formas son (..., M, K) y (..., K, N) , respectivamente, donde K = min(M, N) .

trans-unit.source: If True (default), the function for pretty printing (__repr__) is set, if False the function that returns the default string representation (__str__) is set.
trans-unit.target: Si es Verdadero (predeterminado), se establece la función para impresión bonita ( __repr__ ), si es Falso, se establece la función que devuelve la representación de cadena predeterminada ( __str__ ).

trans-unit.source: If True a sparse grid is returned in order to conserve memory. Default is False.
trans-unit.target: Si es cierto,se devuelve una red escasa para conservar la memoria.Por defecto es Falso.

trans-unit.source: If True, M is assumed to be Hermitian (symmetric if real-valued), enabling a more efficient method for finding singular values. Defaults to False.
trans-unit.target: Si es Verdadero, se supone que M es hermitiano (simétrico si tiene un valor real), lo que permite un método más eficiente para encontrar valores singulares. El valor predeterminado es Falso.

trans-unit.source: If True, a is assumed to be Hermitian (symmetric if real-valued), enabling a more efficient method for finding singular values. Defaults to False.
trans-unit.target: Si es verdad, a se supone que es hermitiana (simétrica si valor real-), lo que permite un método más eficiente para encontrar valores singulares. El valor predeterminado es Falso.

trans-unit.source: If True, c_or_r specifies the polynomial’s roots; the default is False.
trans-unit.target: Si es verdadero, c_or_r especifica las raíces del polinomio; El valor predeterminado es falso.

trans-unit.source: If True, stop is the last sample. Otherwise, it is not included. Default is True.
trans-unit.target: Si es Verdadero, stop es la última muestra. De lo contrario, no está incluido. El valor predeterminado es verdadero.

trans-unit.source: If True, NaNs will compare equal.
trans-unit.target: Si es cierto,los NaNs se compararán de igual a igual.

trans-unit.source: If True, align the fields by padding as the C-compiler would. Default is False.
trans-unit.target: Si es cierto,alinee los campos por el relleno como lo haría el compilador C.Por defecto es Falso.

trans-unit.source: If True, also repack nested structures.
If True, also return the indices of ar (along the specified axis, if provided, or in the flattened array) that result in the unique array.
trans-unit.target: Si es True, también devuelve los índices de ar (a lo largo del eje especificado, si se proporciona, o en la matriz plana) que dan como resultado la matriz única.

trans-unit.source: If True, also return the indices of the unique array (for the specified axis, if provided) that can be used to reconstruct ar.
trans-unit.target: Si es Verdadero, también devuelve los índices de la matriz única (para el eje especificado, si se proporciona) que se pueden usar para reconstruir ar .

trans-unit.source: If True, also return the number of times each unique item appears in ar.
trans-unit.target: Si es Verdadero, también devuelve el número de veces que aparece cada elemento único en ar .

trans-unit.source: If True, always print floating point numbers using fixed point notation, in which case numbers equal to zero in the current precision will print as zero. If False, then scientific notation is used when absolute value of the smallest number is < 1e-4 or the ratio of the maximum absolute value to the minimum is > 1e3. The default is False.
trans-unit.target: Si es Verdadero, imprima siempre números de punto flotante utilizando notación de punto fijo, en cuyo caso los números iguales a cero en la precisión actual se imprimirán como cero. Si es Falso, entonces se usa notación científica cuando el valor absoluto del número más pequeño es <1e-4 o la relación entre el valor absoluto máximo y el mínimo es> 1e3. El valor predeterminado es falso.

trans-unit.source: If True, always returns a tuple.
trans-unit.target: Si es cierto,siempre devuelve una tupla.

trans-unit.source: If True, an exception is raised if an inconsistency is detected in the number of columns. If False, a warning is emitted and the offending lines are skipped.
trans-unit.target: Si es cierto,se plantea una excepción si se detecta una inconsistencia en el número de columnas.Si es Falso,se emite una advertencia y se saltan las líneas infractoras.

trans-unit.source: If True, do not raise errors for invalid values.
trans-unit.target: Si es cierto,no plantee errores por valores inválidos.

trans-unit.source: If True, field names are case sensitive. If False or ‘upper’, field names are converted to upper case. If ‘lower’, field names are converted to lower case.
trans-unit.target: Si es verdadero, los nombres de los campos distinguen entre mayúsculas y minúsculas. Si es False o 'superior', los nombres de los campos se convierten a mayúsculas. Si es 'inferior', los nombres de los campos se convierten a minúsculas.

trans-unit.source: If True, fields in the dst for which there was no matching field in the src are filled with the value 0 (zero). This was the behavior of numpy <= 1.13. If False, those fields are not modified.
If True, masked values are propagated pair-wise: if a value is masked in x, the corresponding value is masked in y. If False, raises a ValueError exception when some values are missing.
trans-unit.target: Si es Verdadero, los valores enmascarados se propagan por pares: si un valor está enmascarado en x , el valor correspondiente está enmascarado en y . Si es False, genera una excepción ValueError cuando faltan algunos valores.

trans-unit.source: If True, masked values are propagated pair-wise: if a value is masked in x, the corresponding value is masked in y. If False, raises an exception. Because bias is deprecated, this argument needs to be treated as keyword only to avoid a warning.
trans-unit.target: Si es Verdadero, los valores enmascarados se propagan por pares: si un valor está enmascarado en x , el valor correspondiente está enmascarado en y . Si es falso, genera una excepción. Debido a que el bias está en desuso, este argumento debe tratarse como una palabra clave solo para evitar una advertencia.

trans-unit.source: If True, report coverage of NumPy code. Default is False. (This requires the coverage module).
If True, return (samples, step), where step is the spacing between samples.
trans-unit.target: Si es Verdadero, devuelve ( samples , step ), donde step es el espacio entre muestras.

trans-unit.source: If True, return a subprocess.CompletedProcess containing the stdout and stderr of the compile process, instead of just the status code.
If True, return a masked array. If False, return a regular array.
trans-unit.target: Si es cierto,devuelve un conjunto enmascarado.Si es falso,devuelve una matriz normal.

trans-unit.source: If True, run doctests in module. Default is False.
If True, specifies that the decorated callable is a test. If False, specifies that the decorated callable is not a test. Default is True.
trans-unit.target: Si es cierto,especifica que el adorno de la llamada es una prueba.Si es falso,especifica que el plato decorado no es una prueba.Por defecto es True.

trans-unit.source: If True, sub-classes will be passed-through, otherwise the returned array will be forced to be a base-class array (default).
If True, subclasses are preserved.
trans-unit.target: Si es cierto,las subclases se conservan.

trans-unit.source: If True, the axes which are reduced are left in the result as dimensions with size one. With this option, the result will broadcast correctly against the original arr.
trans-unit.target: Si es verdadero, los ejes que se reducen se dejan en el resultado como dimensiones con tamaño uno. Con esta opción, el resultado se transmitirá correctamente contra el arr original .

trans-unit.source: If True, the conflicting values are appended to the error message.
trans-unit.target: Si es True,los valores en conflicto se añaden al mensaje de error.

trans-unit.source: If True, the indices which correspond to the intersection of the two arrays are returned. The first instance of a value is used if there are multiple. Default is False.
trans-unit.target: Si es cierto,se devuelven los índices que corresponden a la intersección de las dos matrices.La primera instancia de un valor se utiliza si hay múltiples.Por defecto es Falso.

trans-unit.source: If True, the input arrays are both assumed to be unique, which can speed up the calculation. Default is False.
trans-unit.target: Si es cierto,se supone que las matrices de entrada son únicas,lo que puede acelerar el cálculo.Por defecto es Falso.

trans-unit.source: If True, the input arrays are both assumed to be unique, which can speed up the calculation. If True but ar1 or ar2 are not unique, incorrect results and out-of-bounds indices could result. Default is False.
If True, the iterator was created with either the c_index or the f_index flag, and the property index can be used to retrieve it.
trans-unit.target: Si es True, el iterador se creó con el c_index o f_index , y el index propiedad se puede usar para recuperarlo.

trans-unit.source: If True, the iterator was created with the delay_bufalloc flag, and no reset() function was called on it yet.
trans-unit.target: Si es True, el iterador se creó con el indicador delay_bufalloc y aún no se llamó a la función reset ().

trans-unit.source: If True, the iterator was created with the multi_index flag, and the property multi_index can be used to retrieve it.
trans-unit.target: Si es True, el iterador se creó con el indicador multi_index y se puede usar la propiedad multi_index para recuperarlo.

trans-unit.source: If True, the returned array is transposed, so that arguments may be unpacked using x, y, z = genfromtxt(...). When used with a structured data-type, arrays are returned for each field. Default is False.
If True, the returned array is transposed, so that arguments may be unpacked using x, y, z = loadtxt(...)
trans-unit.target: Si es True, la matriz devuelta se transpone, por lo que los argumentos se pueden descomprimir usando x, y, z = loadtxt(...)

trans-unit.source: If True, the returned array is transposed, so that arguments may be unpacked using x, y, z = loadtxt(...). When used with a structured data-type, arrays are returned for each field. Default is False.
trans-unit.target: Si es True, la matriz devuelta se transpone, por lo que los argumentos se pueden descomprimir usando x, y, z = loadtxt(...) . Cuando se usa con un tipo de datos estructurado, se devuelven matrices para cada campo. El valor predeterminado es falso.

trans-unit.source: If True, the shape of the coefficient array is extended with ones on the right, one for each dimension of x. Scalars have dimension 0 for this action. The result is that every column of coefficients in c is evaluated for every element of x. If False, x is broadcast over the columns of c for the evaluation. This keyword is useful when c is multidimensional. The default value is True.
trans-unit.target: Si es True, la forma de la matriz de coeficientes se extiende con unos a la derecha, uno para cada dimensión de x . Los escalares tienen dimensión 0 para esta acción. El resultado es que cada columna de coeficientes en c se evalúa para cada elemento de x . Si es False, x se difunde sobre las columnas de c para la evaluación. Esta palabra clave es útil cuando c es multidimensional. El valor por defecto es verdadero.

trans-unit.source: If True, the shape of the roots array is extended with ones on the right, one for each dimension of x. Scalars have dimension 0 for this action. The result is that every column of coefficients in r is evaluated for every element of x. If False, x is broadcast over the columns of r for the evaluation. This keyword is useful when r is multidimensional. The default value is True.
trans-unit.target: Si es True, la forma de la matriz de raíces se extiende con unas a la derecha, una para cada dimensión de x . Los escalares tienen dimensión 0 para esta acción. El resultado es que cada columna de coeficientes en r se evalúa para cada elemento de x . Si es falso, x se difunde sobre las columnas de r para la evaluación. Esta palabra clave es útil cuando r es multidimensional. El valor por defecto es verdadero.

trans-unit.source: If True, the spaces at the end of Strings are removed before the comparison.

If True, the values in the returned array are inverted (that is, False where an element of ar1 is in ar2 and True otherwise). Default is False. np.in1d(a, b, invert=True) is equivalent to (but is faster than) np.invert(in1d(a, b)).
trans-unit.target: Si es True, los valores de la matriz devuelta se invierten (es decir, False donde un elemento de ar1 está en ar2 y True en caso contrario). El valor predeterminado es falso. np.in1d(a, b, invert=True) es equivalente a (pero es más rápido que) np.invert(in1d(a, b)) .

trans-unit.source: If True, the values in the returned array are inverted, as if calculating element not in test_elements. Default is False. np.isin(a, b, invert=True) is equivalent to (but faster than) np.invert(np.isin(a, b)).
trans-unit.target: Si es True, los valores de la matriz devuelta se invierten, como si el element not in test_elements calculado no estuviera en test_elements . El valor predeterminado es falso. np.isin(a, b, invert=True) es equivalente a (pero más rápido que) np.invert(np.isin(a, b)) .

trans-unit.source: If True, then allow the input array a to be modified by intermediate calculations, to save memory. In this case, the contents of the input a after this function completes is undefined.
trans-unit.target: Si es verdadero, a continuación, permitir que la matriz de entrada a a ser modificado por cálculos intermedios, para ahorrar memoria. En este caso, el contenido de la entrada a después de que se complete esta función no está definido.

trans-unit.source: If True, then allow use of memory of input array (a) for calculations. The input array will be modified by the call to median. This will save memory when you do not need to preserve the contents of the input array. Treat the input as undefined, but it will probably be fully or partially sorted. Default is False. Note that, if overwrite_input is True, and the input is not already an ndarray, an error will be raised.

If True, then allow use of memory of input array (a) for calculations. The input array will be modified by the call to median. This will save memory when you do not need to preserve the contents of the input array. Treat the input as undefined, but it will probably be fully or partially sorted. Default is False. Note that, if overwrite_input is True, and the input is not already an ndarray, an error will be raised.
trans-unit.target: Si es verdadero, permita el uso de la memoria de la matriz de entrada (a) para los cálculos. La matriz de entrada será modificada por la llamada a median. El valor predeterminado es falso. Tenga en cuenta que, si overwrite_input es Verdadero, y la entrada aún no es un ndarray , se generará un error.

If a Council member becomes inactive in the project for a period of one year, they will be considered for removal from the Council. Before removal, inactive Member will be approached to see if they plan on returning to active participation. If not they will be removed immediately upon a Council vote. If they plan on returning to active participation soon, they will be given a grace period of one year. If they don’t return to active participation within that time period they will be removed by vote of the Council without further grace period. All former Council members can be considered for membership again at any time in the future, like any other Project Contributor. Retired Council members will be listed on the project website, acknowledging the period during which they were active in the Council.

trans-unit.source: If given and not False, return not just the estimate but also its covariance matrix. By default, the covariance are scaled by chi2/dof, where dof = M - (deg + 1), i.e., the weights are presumed to be unreliable except in a relative sense and everything is scaled such that the reduced chi2 is unity. This scaling is omitted if cov='unscaled', as is relevant for the case that the weights are 1/sigma**2, with sigma known to be a reliable estimate of the uncertainty.

If given and not False, return not just the estimate but also its covariance matrix. By default, the covariance are scaled by chi2/sqrt(N-dof), i.e., the weights are presumed to be unreliable except in a relative sense and everything is scaled such that the reduced chi2 is unity. This scaling is omitted if cov='unscaled', as is relevant for the case that the weights are 1/sigma**2, with sigma known to be a reliable estimate of the uncertainty.
trans-unit.target: Si se da y no es False , devuelva no solo la estimación sino también su matriz de covarianza. Esta escala se omite si cov='unscaled' , como es relevante para el caso de que los pesos sean 1 / sigma ** 2, y se sabe que sigma es una estimación confiable de la incertidumbre.

trans-unit.source: If it becomes necessary for the Steering Council to produce a formal decision, then they will use a form of the Apache Foundation voting process. This is a formalized version of consensus, in which +1 votes indicate agreement, -1 votes are vetoes (and must be accompanied with a rationale, as above), and one can also vote fractionally (e.g. -0.5, +0.5) if one wishes to express an opinion without registering a full veto. These numeric votes are also often used informally as a way of getting a general sense of people’s feelings on some issue, and should not normally be taken as formal votes. A formal vote only occurs if explicitly declared, and if this does occur then the vote should be held open for long enough to give all interested Council Members a chance to respond – at least one week.

trans-unit.source: If obj is an ndarray (PyArrayObject *), then the data-area of the ndarray is pointed to by the void* pointer PyArray_DATA (obj) or the char* pointer PyArray_BYTES (obj). Remember that (in general) this data-area may not be aligned according to the data-type, it may represent byte-swapped data, and/or it may not be writeable. If the data area is aligned and in native byte-order, then how to get at a specific element of the array is determined only by the array of npy_intp variables, PyArray_STRIDES (obj). In particular, this c-array of integers shows how many bytes must be added to the current element pointer to get to the next element in each dimension. For arrays less than 4-dimensions there are PyArray_GETPTR{k} (obj, …) macros where {k} is the integer 1, 2, 3, or 4 that make using the array strides easier. The arguments …. represent {k} non- negative integer indices into the array. For example, suppose E is a 3-dimensional ndarray. A (void*) pointer to the element E[i,j,k] is obtained as PyArray_GETPTR3 (E, i, j, k).

If offsets were specified using the optional offsets key in the dictionary-based dtype specification, setting align=True will check that each field’s offset is a multiple of its size and that the itemsize is a multiple of the largest field size, and raise an exception if not.

If one of the input or output arguments has a __array_ufunc__ method, it is executed instead of the ufunc. If more than one of the arguments implements __array_ufunc__, they are tried in the order: subclasses before superclasses, inputs before outputs, otherwise left to right. The first routine returning something other than NotImplemented determines the result. If all of the __array_ufunc__ operations return NotImplemented, a TypeError is raised.
trans-unit.target: Si uno de los argumentos de entrada o salida tiene un método __array_ufunc__ , se ejecuta en lugar de ufunc. Si más de uno de los argumentos implementa __array_ufunc__ , se prueban en el orden: subclases antes que superclases, entradas antes que salidas, en caso contrario, de izquierda a derecha. La primera rutina que devuelve algo que no sea NotImplemented determina el resultado. Si todas las operaciones __array_ufunc__ devuelven NotImplemented , se genera un TypeError .

trans-unit.source: If slice notation is used, the syntax start:stop:step is equivalent to np.arange(start, stop, step) inside of the brackets. However, if step is an imaginary number (i.e. 100j) then its integer portion is interpreted as a number-of-points desired and the start and stop are inclusive. In other words start:stop:stepj is interpreted as np.linspace(start, stop, step, endpoint=1) inside of the brackets. After expansion of slice notation, all comma separated sequences are concatenated together.
trans-unit.target: Si se usa la notación de sector, la sintaxis start:stop:step es equivalente a np.arange(start, stop, step) dentro de los corchetes. Sin embargo, si el step es un número imaginario (es decir, 100j), entonces su parte entera se interpreta como un número de puntos deseado y el inicio y la parada son inclusivos. En otras palabras, start:stop:stepj se interpreta como np.linspace(start, stop, step, endpoint=1) dentro de los corchetes. Después de la expansión de la notación de corte, todas las secuencias separadas por comas se concatenan juntas.

trans-unit.source: If some of the singular values of V are so small that they are neglected (and full == False), a RankWarning will be raised. This means that the coefficient values may be poorly determined. Fitting to a lower order polynomial will usually get rid of the warning (but may not be what you want, of course; if you have independent reason(s) for choosing the degree which isn’t working, you may have to: a) reconsider those reasons, and/or b) reconsider the quality of your data). The rcond parameter can also be set to a value smaller than its default, but the resulting fit may be spurious and have large contributions from roundoff error.

The rcond parameter can also be set to a value smaller than its default, but the resulting fit may be spurious and have large contributions from roundoff error.

Esto significa que los valores de los coeficientes pueden estar mal determinados. El ajuste a un polinomio de orden inferior generalmente eliminará la advertencia (pero puede que no sea lo que desea, por supuesto; si tiene razones independientes para elegir el título que no funciona, es posible que deba: a) reconsiderar esos motivos, y / o b) reconsiderar la calidad de sus datos). El parámetro rcond también se puede establecer en un valor menor que su predeterminado, pero el ajuste resultante puede ser falso y tener grandes contribuciones del error de redondeo.

trans-unit.source: If some of the singular values of V are so small that they are neglected, then a RankWarning will be issued. This means that the coefficient values may be poorly determined. Using a lower order fit will usually get rid of the warning. The rcond parameter can also be set to a value smaller than its default, but the resulting fit may be spurious and have large contributions from roundoff error.

trans-unit.source: If the API has changed, increment the C_API_VERSION in setup_common.py. The API is unchanged only if any code compiled against the current API will be backward compatible with the last released NumPy version. Any changes to C structures or additions to the public interface will make the new API not backward compatible.
If the CPU feature is not supported by the user platform or compiler, it will be skipped rather than raising a fatal error.

If the C_API_VERSION in the first step has changed, or if the hash of the API has changed, the cversions.txt file needs to be updated. To check the hash, run the script numpy/core/cversions.py and note the API hash that is printed. If that hash does not match the last hash in numpy/core/code_generators/cversions.txt the hash has changed. Using both the appropriate C_API_VERSION and hash, add a new entry to cversions.txt. If the API version was not changed, but the hash differs, you will need to comment out the previous entry for that API version. For instance, in NumPy 1.9 annotations were added, which changed the hash, but the API was the same as in 1.8. The hash serves as a check for API changes, but it is not definitive.

trans-unit.source: If the ufunc has 2 inputs and 1 output and the second input is an Object array then a special-case check is performed so that NotImplemented is returned if the second input is not an ndarray, has the __array_priority__ attribute, and has an __r{op}__ special method. In this way, Python is signaled to give the other object a chance to complete the operation instead of using generic object-array calculations. This allows (for example) sparse matrices to override the multiplication operator 1-D loop.
trans-unit.target: Si el ufunc tiene 2 entradas y 1 salida y la segunda entrada es un array de objetos,se realiza una comprobación de caso especial para que se devuelva NotImplemented si la segunda entrada no es un ndarray,tiene el atributo __array_priority__y tiene un método especial __r{op}__.De esta forma,se señala a Python para dar al otro objeto la oportunidad de completar la operación en lugar de utilizar cálculos genéricos de objetos-matrices.Esto permite (por ejemplo)que las matrices dispersas anulen el bucle del operador de multiplicación 1-D.

The size of the result array created by broadcast operations is the maximum size along each dimension from the input arrays. Note that the rule does not say anything about the two arrays needing to have the same number of dimensions. So, for example, if you have a 256 x 256 x 3 array of RGB values, and you want to scale each color in the image by a different value, you can multiply the image by a one-dimensional array with 3 values. Lining up the sizes of the trailing axes of these arrays according to the broadcast rule shows that they are compatible

trans-unit.source: If this is non-NULL, then this data-type-descriptor has fields described by a Python dictionary whose keys are names (and also titles if given) and whose values are tuples that describe the fields. Recall that a data-type-descriptor always describes a fixed-length set of bytes. A field is a named sub-region of that total, fixed-length collection. A field is described by a tuple composed of another data- type-descriptor and a byte offset. Optionally, the tuple may contain a title which is normally a Python string. These tuples are placed in this dictionary keyed by name (and also title if given).
trans-unit.target: Si esto no es NULL,entonces este descriptor de tipo de datos tiene campos descritos por un diccionario Python cuyas claves son nombres (y también títulos si se dan)y cuyos valores son tuplas que describen los campos.Recordemos que un descriptor de tipo de datos siempre describe un conjunto de bytes de longitud fija.Un campo es una sub-región nombrada de esa colección total de longitudes fijas.Un campo se describe por una tupla compuesta por otro tipo de datos-descriptor y un desplazamiento de bytes.Opcionalmente,la tupla puede contener un título que normalmente es una cadena de Python.Estas tuplas se colocan en este diccionario tecleadas por nombre (y también por título si se da).

If you do want to use Fortran ordering realize that there are two approaches to consider: 1) accept that the first index is just not the most rapidly changing in memory and have all your I/O routines reorder your data when going from memory to disk or visa versa, or use numpy’s mechanism for mapping the first index to the most rapidly varying data. We recommend the former if possible. The disadvantage of the latter is that many of numpy’s functions will yield arrays without Fortran ordering unless you are careful to use the ‘order’ keyword. Doing this would be highly inconvenient.
trans-unit.target: Si desea utilizar la ordenación de Fortran, tenga en cuenta que hay dos enfoques a considerar: 1) acepte que el primer índice no es el que cambia más rápidamente en la memoria y haga que todas sus rutinas de E / S reordenen sus datos al pasar de la memoria al disco o viceversa, o use el mecanismo de Numpy para mapear el primer índice con los datos que varían más rápidamente. Recomendamos el primero si es posible. La desventaja de este último es que muchas de las funciones de numpy producirán matrices sin el orden de Fortran a menos que tenga cuidado de usar la palabra clave 'order'. Hacer esto sería muy inconveniente.

If you subclass ndarray, we recommend that you put all your override logic in __array_ufunc__ and not also override special methods. This ensures the class hierarchy is determined in only one place rather than separately by the ufunc machinery and by the binary operation rules (which gives preference to special methods of subclasses; the alternative way to enforce a one-place only hierarchy, of setting __array_ufunc__ to None, would seem very unexpected and thus confusing, as then the subclass would not work at all with ufuncs).
trans-unit.target: Si subclasifica ndarray , le recomendamos que ponga toda su lógica de anulación en __array_ufunc__ y no anule también métodos especiales. Esto asegura que la jerarquía de clases esté determinada en un solo lugar en lugar de por separado por la maquinaria ufunc y por las reglas de operación binaria (que da preferencia a métodos especiales de subclases; la forma alternativa de hacer cumplir una jerarquía de un solo lugar, de establecer __array_ufunc__ a None , parecería muy inesperado y, por lo tanto, confuso, ya que entonces la subclase no funcionaría en absoluto con ufuncs).

trans-unit.source: If you subclass ndarray, we recommend that you put all your override logic in __array_ufunc__ and not also override special methods. This ensures the class hierarchy is determined in only one place rather than separately by the ufunc machinery and by the binary operation rules (which gives preference to special methods of subclasses; the alternative way to enforce a one-place only hierarchy, of setting __array_ufunc__ to None, would seem very unexpected and thus confusing, as then the subclass would not work at all with ufuncs).

Then, you can register data-types that can be cast to separately for each scalar kind that may be returned from your user-defined data-type. If you don’t register scalar coercion handling, then all of your user-defined data-types will be seen as NPY_NOSCALAR.

If you want to learn more about C and Fortran order, you can read more about the internal organization of NumPy arrays here. Essentially, C and Fortran orders have to do with how indices correspond to the order the array is stored in memory. In Fortran, when moving through the elements of a two-dimensional array as it is stored in memory, the first index is the most rapidly varying index. As the first index moves to the next row as it changes, the matrix is stored one column at a time. This is why Fortran is thought of as a Column-major language. In C on the other hand, the last index changes the most rapidly. The matrix is stored by rows, making it a Row-major language. What you do for C or Fortran depends on whether it’s more important to preserve the indexing convention or not reorder the data.

trans-unit.source: Implements the rules for scalar coercion. Scalars are only silently coerced from thistype to neededtype if this function returns nonzero. If scalar is NPY_NOSCALAR, then this function is equivalent to PyArray_CanCastSafely. The rule is that scalars of the same KIND can be coerced into arrays of the same KIND. This rule means that high-precision scalars will never cause low-precision arrays of the same KIND to be upcast.

Implements the rules for scalar coercion. Scalars are only silently coerced from thistype to neededtype if this function returns nonzero. If scalar is NPY_NOSCALAR, then this function is equivalent to PyArray_CanCastSafely. The rule is that scalars of the same KIND can be coerced into arrays of the same KIND. This rule means that high-precision scalars will never cause low-precision arrays of the same KIND to be upcast.
trans-unit.target: Implementa las reglas de coerción escalar. Los escalares solo son coaccionados silenciosamente de este tipo a tipo necesario si esta función devuelve un valor distinto de cero. Si escalar es NPY_NOSCALAR , entonces esta función es equivalente a PyArray_CanCastSafely . La regla es que los escalares del mismo TIPO se pueden coaccionar en matrices del mismo TIPO. Esta regla significa que los escalares de alta precisión nunca provocarán la conversión ascendente de matrices de baja precisión del mismo TIPO.

trans-unit.source: In explicit mode the output can be directly controlled by specifying output subscript labels. This requires the identifier ‘->’ as well as the list of output subscript labels. This feature increases the flexibility of the function since summing can be disabled or forced when required. The call np.einsum('i->', a) is like np.sum(a, axis=-1), and np.einsum('ii->i', a) is like np.diag(a). The difference is that einsum does not allow broadcasting by default. Additionally np.einsum('ij,jh->ih', a, b) directly specifies the order of the output subscript labels and therefore returns matrix multiplication, unlike the example above in implicit mode.
trans-unit.target: En modo explícito, la salida se puede controlar directamente especificando etiquetas de subíndice de salida. Esto requiere el identificador '->' así como la lista de etiquetas de subíndice de salida. Esta característica aumenta la flexibilidad de la función, ya que la suma se puede desactivar o forzar cuando sea necesario. La llamada np.einsum('i->', a) es como np.sum(a, axis=-1) , y np.einsum('ii->i', a) es como np.diag(a) . La diferencia es que einsum no permite la transmisión por defecto. Además, np.einsum('ij,jh->ih', a, b) especifica directamente el orden de las etiquetas del subíndice de salida y, por lo tanto, devuelve la multiplicación de matrices, a diferencia del ejemplo anterior en modo implícito.

trans-unit.source: In explicit mode, einsum provides further flexibility to compute other array operations that might not be considered classical Einstein summation operations, by disabling, or forcing summation over specified subscript labels.
trans-unit.target: En modo explícito , einsum proporciona mayor flexibilidad para calcular otras operaciones de matriz que podrían no considerarse operaciones de suma de Einstein clásicas, al deshabilitar o forzar la suma sobre etiquetas de subíndice especificadas.

trans-unit.source: In implicit mode, the chosen subscripts are important since the axes of the output are reordered alphabetically. This means that np.einsum('ij', a) doesn’t affect a 2D array, while np.einsum('ji', a) takes its transpose. Additionally, np.einsum('ij,jk', a, b) returns a matrix multiplication, while, np.einsum('ij,jh', a, b) returns the transpose of the multiplication since subscript ‘h’ precedes subscript ‘i’.
trans-unit.target: En modo implícito , los subíndices elegidos son importantes ya que los ejes de la salida se reordenan alfabéticamente. Esto significa que np.einsum('ij', a) no afecta a una matriz 2D, mientras que np.einsum('ji', a) toma su transposición. Además, np.einsum('ij,jk', a, b) devuelve una multiplicación de matrices, mientras que np.einsum('ij,jh', a, b) devuelve la transposición de la multiplicación ya que el subíndice 'h' precede al subíndice 'yo'.

trans-unit.source: In C, there is no equivalent to the deprecation warnings that Python supports. One way to do deprecations is to flag them in the documentation and release notes, then remove or change the deprecated features in a future major version (NumPy 2.0 and beyond). Minor versions of NumPy should not have major C-API changes, however, that prevent code that worked on a previous minor release. For example, we will do our best to ensure that code that compiled and worked on NumPy 1.4 should continue to work on NumPy 1.7 (but perhaps with compiler warnings).
trans-unit.target: En C,no hay equivalente a las advertencias de deprecación que soporta Python.Una forma de hacer deprecaciones es marcarlas en la documentación y en las notas de lanzamiento,y luego eliminar o cambiar las características depreciadas en una futura versión principal (NumPy 2.0 y posteriores).Sin embargo,las versiones menores de NumPy no deben tener cambios importantes en la C-API que impidan que el código funcione en una versión menor anterior.Por ejemplo,haremos todo lo posible para asegurar que el código que compiló y funcionó en NumPy 1.4 debería seguir funcionando en NumPy 1.7 (pero tal vez con advertencias del compilador).

In MATLAB the main tool available to you for customizing the environment is to modify the search path with the locations of your favorite functions. You can put such customizations into a startup script that MATLAB will run on startup.

In MATLAB® the main tool available to you for customizing the environment is to modify the search path with the locations of your favorite functions. You can put such customizations into a startup script that MATLAB will run on startup.
In MATLAB®, arrays have pass-by-value semantics, with a lazy copy-on-write scheme to prevent actually creating copies until they are actually needed. Slice operations copy parts of the array.

In MATLAB®, the basic data type is a multidimensional array of double precision floating point numbers. Most expressions take such arrays and return such arrays. Operations on the 2-D instances of these arrays are designed to act more or less like matrix operations in linear algebra.

In MATLAB, the basic type, even for scalars, is a multidimensional array. Array assignments in MATLAB are stored as 2D arrays of double precision floating point numbers, unless you specify the number of dimensions and type. Operations on the 2D instances of these arrays are modeled on matrix operations in linear algebra.

trans-unit.source: In NumPy, dimensions are called axes. This means that if you have a 2D array that looks like this:

In NumPy, the basic type is a multidimensional array. Array assignments in NumPy are usually stored as n-dimensional arrays with the minimum type required to hold the objects in sequence, unless you specify the number of dimensions and type. NumPy performs operations element-by-element, so multiplying 2D arrays with * is not a matrix multiplication – it’s an element-by-element multiplication. (The @ operator, available since Python 3.5, can be used for conventional matrix multiplication.)
